text:
As our MLJ.jl project just pushed through 1000 stars I wanted to take the opportunity to thank two of our most influencial volunteer contributors over the last year: <@U7THT3TM3> ’s help with assorted technical issues (CI in particular) has saved us countless hours of pain. As I know he helps out in many other projects, I am always grateful with how quickly he responds to my calls for help. Also, together with <@U81PB6N77>, he relentlessly navigated many hurdles we threw in his way to make the SossMLJ integration happen. Many thanks <@U7THT3TM3>! :heart:

Secondly I should like to thank our secret weapon <@UAZP7LJLU>. <@UAZP7LJLU> has provided, pro bono, very substantial contributions to MLJ. These include the implementation and maintenance of the MLJ model API for multiple third party packages. He is a co-creator of NearestNeighborModels.jl, which provides our KNN models. He implemented most of MLJ’s multi-threading and distributed computing support. Samuel has reviewed sustantial parts of MLJ code base, revealing multiple weaknesses, as well as opporunities for performance improvements, which he has implemented or helped to implement. He has assisted dozens of users with help on slack and github, and has provided valuable diagnositics for trickier issues. Thanks again <@UAZP7LJLU>! :heart:

text: Thanks <@UD0SQV5LL>. There are always some challenges in bridging across ecosystems; thanks for sticking with us through the process! And thanks also to <@UDP5WL2RX> for helping spin up the the package :slightly_smiling_face:
